topic.title: zeronet app via orbot and orfox
topic.body: I've tried to connect to connect zeronet via orbot, and tried to open zeronet through orfox. sorted through orbot's setting, and, typed in the local host address and port. Nothing. Any help?

1553607490_1NYxK9cC899pvxFuCt6eE53APoueD.body:
> [infinyte](#comment_3_1NYxK9cC899pvxFuCt6eE53APoueDrhmS5): I agree. They cant shutdown this as easily as a centralized server.

I imagine they'll try to create distrust by seeding content with a virus embedded that might create a backdoor on user devices.

1553629147_1MkZQvQJrFXBXQ3x5UWQV52jhhi1j.body: Yeah, I tried outbound proxy, entry, and exit node, disable https everywhere and noscripts, still nothing worked. There's a tether optiom I could try. Hope it works.

1552480101_153dW34Ng5fVUZ5D5NcZRfAbvRQS1.body:
> [tomasz21](#comment_56_1DNH5keUZtST9ACf8Hdre5QzmSGKZh8FRw): Zadam zasadnicze pytanie; Dla kogo pracuje Firefox?I will ask the main question; Who does Firefox work for?

Firefox is suppose to be non-profit, ran by eff?
